TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed EnvironmentPermissionAccess extends System.Enum

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by <xref:System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermission>.
> [!NOTE] > Although NoAccess and AllAccess appear in EnvironmentPermissionAccess, they are not valid for use as the parameter for <xref:System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermission.GetPathList%2A> because they describe no environment variable access types or all environment variable access types, respectively, and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermission.GetPathList%2A> expects a single environment variable access type.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermissionAccess AllAccess = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Read and Write access to environment variables. AllAccess represents multiple EnvironmentPermissionAccess values and causes an when used as the parameter for the method, which expects a single value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermissionAccess NoAccess = int32(0)

Docs.summary: No access to environment variables. NoAccess represents no valid EnvironmentPermissionAccess values and causes an when used as the parameter for , which expects a single value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermissionAccess Read = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Only read access to environment variables is specified. Changing, deleting and creating environment variables is not included in this access level.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Security.Permissions.EnvironmentPermissionAccess Write = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Only write access to environment variables is specified. Write access includes creating and deleting environment variables as well as changing existing values. Reading environment variables is not included in this access level.
